result.execSummary:
The defendant Trevon Sanders was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
*Defendant to serve 10 months at the House of Correction commencing 3-21-16 with Huber privileges for actual work and 2 days credit.
*Court allows the time can be served in Waukesha County, if accepted.

*As to both counts: Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample, pay the DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  If the defendant possesses a firearm within 5 years of the completion of this sentence, he will be subject to a 3 year mandatory initial confinement.

*As to both counts: Pay a fine of $190 plus mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges at the rate of $20 (for a total of $40) per month commencing 6-1-16 if a payment is more than 10 days late, a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.
*Defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

Concurrent with: With Count 1 - with Huber privileges for actual work and 2 days credit.
*Court allows the time can be served in Waukesha County, if accepted.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trevon Sanders

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
See CCAP financial payment plan application for specific monthly due dates for this UTPPP.

Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance or alcohol forfeits the release privileges. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement received and filed.

Defendant Trevon Sanders in court with attorney Ann Rene Auberry.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.   Statements by counsel, Raven A. and defendant.

Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample, pay the DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  If the defendant possesses a firearm within 5 years of the completion of this sentence, he will be subject to a 3 year mandatory initial confinement.

Count 1:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 10 months at the House of Correction commencing 3-21-16 with Huber privileges for actual work and 2 days credit; pay a fine of $190 plus mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges at the rate of $20 (for a total of $40) per month commencing 6-1-16 if a payment is more than 10 days late, a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Count 2:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 10 months at the House of Correction - commening 3-21-16 - concurrent with Count 1 - with Huber privileges for actual work and 2 days credit; pay a fine of $190 plus mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges at the rate of $20 (for a total of $40) per month commencing 6-1-16 if a payment is more than 10 days late, a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Court allows the time can be served in Waukesha County, if accepted.

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.
Justice Point report dated 3-11-16 received and filed./ds

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 72 hours in advance of sentencing.

Since incarceration is a possibility, defendant should be prepared to start serving the sentence at the next date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Trevon Sanders in court with attorney Ann Rene Auberry.  Dennis Patrick Murphy for Zachary Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to Counts 1 & 2 and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 1 & 2 as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

On motion of the State, Court reads-in an uncharged count from 10-6-15 of possession of THC for sentencing purposes.
Justice Point report dated 2-16-16 received and filed./ds

Defendant Trevon Sanders in court with attorney Ann Rene Auberry.  Dennis Patrick Murphy for Zachary Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense received discovery and needs time to review with the defendant.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point report dated 1-21-16 received and filed./ds

Defendant Trevon Sanders in court with attorney Ann Auberry.  Dennis Murphy for Zachary Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Konkol,  Branch 44.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 1/14/16.
css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Trevon Sanders in court with attorney Melissa Nepomiachi.  Defendant Trevon Sanders in custody.  
Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: sm  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Case adjourned for preliminary in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
